snippet: As Hugo Chávez arrived in Havana, Venezuelans grappled with the prospect that their president may become too ill to be sworn in again next month.
abstract: Venezuela's Pres Hugo Chavez arrives in Cuba to have surgery for what appears to be aggressive form of cancer, leaving behind nation hanging on outcome of his treatment.

byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and DENISE GRADY
byline.contributor: William Neuman reported from Caracas, Venezuela, and Denise Grady from New York.

lead_paragraph: As Hugo Chávez arrived in Havana, Venezuelans grappled with the prospect that their president may become too ill to be sworn in again next month.

headline.seo: Chávez Goes to Cuba for Cancer Surgery
headline.main: Chávez in Cuba for Cancer Surgery
headline.print_headline: Chávez in Cuba for Cancer Surgery
